private_information: I am allowed to move disks A, B, C, D, E
I can perform primitive moves of the form move disk X from pegY to pegZ
agent_1.goal: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that, together with agent_2 moves, will achieve the global goal configuration while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and my disk movement restrictions

private_information: I am allowed to move disks F, G, H, I, J
I can perform primitive moves of the form move disk X from pegY to pegZ
agent_2.goal: Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that, together with agent_1 moves, will achieve the global goal configuration while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules and my disk movement restrictions

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' move lists, validate legality, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the Fast Downward planner that encodes the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and the final goal

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, right.
There are 10 disks labelled A through J where A is the smallest and J is the largest.
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agents are restricted to moving certain disks: agent_1 may move A B C D E and agent_2 may move F G H I J.
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H I J, middle empty, right empty.
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom B E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom A C D, right empty.
Moves must be expressed in the primitive format agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2.

plan.system_prompt: You are an expert cooperative planner constrained to move only specific disks. You must produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you alone will execute. Do not produce PDDL. Produce only a sequence of moves in the exact format agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ. Ensure every move respects the Tower of Hanoi rules and only moves disks A B C D E. If some moves depend on the other agent, indicate them in sequence but do not assume the other agent's moves; produce only the moves you will perform.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information} Your goal: {agents->agent_1->goal} Think step by step and provide a single ordered list of primitive moves. Use the exact move format agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Do not emit PDDL. Ensure each move is legal given the current configuration considering earlier moves in your list, and do not list moves for disks you are not allowed to move.

plan.system_prompt: You are an expert cooperative planner constrained to move only specific disks. You must produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you alone will execute. Do not produce PDDL. Produce only a sequence of moves in the exact format agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ. Ensure every move respects the Tower of Hanoi rules and only moves disks F G H I J. If some moves depend on the other agent, indicate them in sequence but do not assume the other agent's moves; produce only the moves you will perform.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information} Your goal: {agents->agent_2->goal} Think step by step and provide a single ordered list of primitive moves. Use the exact move format agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Do not emit PDDL. Ensure each move is legal given the current configuration considering earlier moves in your list, and do not list moves for disks you are not allowed to move.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling and in preparing problems for the Fast Downward planner. You must integrate the primitive move sequences provided by the agents, validate and if needed reorder or request clarification implicitly, and produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeted to the Fast Downward planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions of the two agents distinct by prefixing action names or using agent-specific predicates. Encode the Tower of Hanoi rules, the initial configuration, and the requested goal. The produced PDDL must compile for Fast Downward standards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the move lists from agent_1 and agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information} Agent 1 provided: {plan_agent_1} Agent 2 provided: {plan_agent_2} Your goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Integrate the provided plans, ensure global legality under Tower of Hanoi rules, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for Fast Downward. Keep agent actions distinct and ensure object and predicate names are consistent. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. If you detect contradictions or illegal moves in the agents' sequences, adjust and document your corrections in comments inside the PDDL problem section as plain comment lines when necessary.
